文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: The reference material used in this work is standard Zircaloy-4 $( \mathbf { Z } \mathbf { y } 4 \ \mathbf { S } \mathbf { T } \mathbf { D } )$ furnished by Cézus of Ugine, France.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: Samples were machined out of a $\mathbf { 1 - m m }$ -thick plate (Zr-1.48Sn-0.21Fe$\mathbf { 0 . 1 1 C r - 0 . 1 0 0 } )$ and fully recrystallized at $9 4 8 ~ \mathrm { K }$ for $^ { 3 \mathrm { ~ h ~ } }$ and $3 0 \ \mathrm { m i n }$ after cold rolling $\mathbf { \vec { \lambda } } \mathbf { A } i =$ $4 \cdot 1 0 ^ { - 1 9 }$ h using $Q / R = 4 0 0 0 0 ~ \mathrm { K } )$ .

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: To increase precipitate size and thereby facilitate their observation, some specimens of the standard Zircaloy-4 were subjected to an additional coarsening heat treatment at $1 0 5 5 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ for ${ \mathfrak { s o } } \mathbf { h }$ This material with large precipitates is referred to as Zy4 HT.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: Some samples (20 by $3 0 \mathrm { \ m m } \mathrm { \dot { \Omega } }$ )have been irradiated on both faces with $1 . 5 \ : \mathrm { M e V } \ : \mathrm { H e ^ { + } }$ ion irradiations in the Van de Graaff ion accelerator of the Centre d'Etudes Nucléaires de Grenoble, at ${ 7 7 ~ \bf K }$ and to a dose of 0.4 displacements per atom (dpa), to simulate neutron irradiation and produce, at the surface, amorphous precipitates.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: Reference and irradiated recrystallized Zircaloy-4 cladding materials have also been used in this work. The chemical compositions of these materials are Zr-1.75Sn-0.23Fe-0.10Cr0.110 and $\mathrm { Z r 1 . 7 1 S n . 0 . 2 1 F e . 0 . 1 2 C r . 0 . 1 5 O . }$ respectively.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: Reference and irradiated recrystallized Zircaloy-4 cladding materials have also been used in this work. The chemical compositions of these materials are Zr-1.75Sn-0.23Fe-0.10Cr0.110 and $\mathrm { Z r 1 . 7 1 S n . 0 . 2 1 F e . 0 . 1 2 C r . 0 . 1 5 O . }$ respectively.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: The irradiated cladding samples (25- mm-long tubes) were exposed to two and three irradiation cycles in the experimental BR3 reactor at about $\bf { 5 9 0 ~ K }$ to fluences of 4.0 and $5 . 4 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \ n \cdot \mathbf { m } ^ { - 2 }$ , respectively.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: The irradiated cladding samples (25- mm-long tubes) were exposed to two and three irradiation cycles in the experimental BR3 reactor at about $\bf { 5 9 0 ~ K }$ to fluences of 4.0 and $5 . 4 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \ n \cdot \mathbf { m } ^ { - 2 }$ , respectively.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
证据片段: The oxide thickness produced during three cycles has been estimated, when preparing thin foils, to be of the order of $1 0 ~ { \mu \mathrm { m } }$ .

证据片段: the internal surface of the cladding samples irradiated for 2 and 3 cycles exhibited a much thicker oxide layer (≈15 μm) than the reference specimens (≈2 μm)

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk2
证据片段: the internal surface of the cladding samples irradiated for 2 and 3 cycles exhibited a much thicker oxide layer (≈15 μm) than the reference specimens (≈2 μm)

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk2
证据片段: The precipitates present in the Zircaloy-4 sheet used in this work are mainly Zr(Fe,Cr)2 Laves phases with both C14 hcp and C15 fcc crystalline structure and an iron/chromium ratio close to 1.7.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: Oxidized precipitate observed in the dense oxide layer, at about one micron from the metal-oxide interface
样品状态: oxidized precipitate in dense oxide layer

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: a dark field from the oxide rings shows it is still composed of nanocrystallites of cubic and monoclinic ZrO2

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: Ion-Irradiated Precipitates—The 1.5 MeV He, ion-irradiated Zircaloy-4 samples present amorphous Zr(Fe,Cr)2 precipitates within a few microns of the surface

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: Their nearest neighbor spacing is equal to 2.2 Å

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: In the dense oxide layer—At a few hundred nanometers away from the metal-oxide interface, both amorphous and nanocrystallized precipitates are observed

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: Amorphous precipitates have a nearest neighbor spacing ranging between 2.2 and 2.8 Å

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk3
证据片段: nanocrystallized precipitates are composed of ZrO2 cubic and monoclinic crystallites

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: in the second third of the oxide layer, it would increase from $1 0 ^ { - 5 0 }$ atm to $1 0 ^ { - 3 5 }$ atm

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: Fe/Cr ratio of the oxidized precipitates decreases but never falls under 0.5

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: small size of the nanocrystallites formed in the precipitates (a few nanometers in size)

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk4
证据片段: temperature of the tetragonal to monoclinic transformation is significantly decreased when $\mathbf { F e } _ { 3 } \mathbf { O } _ { 4 }$ is introduced into tetragonal zirconia

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk5
证据片段: At the very beginning of their oxidation, zirconium and Zircaloy-4 have the same behavior.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk5
证据片段: they undergo a large volume expansion (estimated at a few tens of a percent [20])

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk5
证据片段: During the oxidation of ion-irradiated Zircaloy-4, the amorphous precipitates behave like reference ones.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk5
证据片段: the precipitate size, which is known to greatly influence the oxidation kinetics, decreases considerably under irradiation.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk5
证据片段: After 60 days of oxidation, they both formed the same oxide thickness.

证据片段: white spots often arise in this black film, and appear in metallographic cross sections as lensshaped oxide spots along with a local significant increase of oxide layer thickness
腐蚀数据: white spots, lens-shaped oxide spots, local oxide thickness increase

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk7
证据片段: At long exposure times, these nodules can grow together to form an almost uniform thick oxide layer.
腐蚀数据: nodules grow together to form uniform thick oxide layer

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk7
证据片段: The nodular corrosion can be simulated out of pile in high pressure $( > 6 0$ bar) steam tests at high temperatures (450 to $5 5 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C } )$ .
